CatDescriptText: Miss Roseann Furga, secretary, Castle Shannon and Miss Karen Valent, secretary, Oakdale, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 7, 1960, pg. A1  with question: "Do you think that the United States is gaining or losing its prestige in the world?"  Ms. Furga's answer reads: "Gaining in everything, like manufacturing and other industries and in leadership."  Ms. Valent's answer reads: "We're holding our own and not losing any ground.  Because we have the highest standard of living, people have to look to us."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Roseann Furga wearing light colored unbuttoned coat with paisley collar, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Karen Mays wearing eyeglasses and patterned skirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
